Name.label: Pulmonary arterial hypertension associated with schistosomiasis
Pulmonary arterial hypertension associated with another disease

TextSection.Contents: Pulmonary arterial hypertension associated with schistosomiasis (PAHS) is a form of pulmonary arterial hypertension (see this term) characterized by an elevated pulmonary arterial resistance leading to right heart failure, observed as a complication of a chronic schistosomiasis (see this term).
